item.title: Report E-2025040273
item.description:
Report E-2025040273

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 12:30 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (BCO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 1 gallon of Carboline Carboguard 635 Part A (hazardous - UN1263)) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the cardboard box. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 4 damaged cans, and box will be placed into a 20-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Charlie (Chemtrec) who provided report #2025031300136.

item.title: Report E-2025040167
item.description:
Report E-2025040167

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND TRAINING SOLUTIONS, INCORPORATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured pail containing hazardous product, Vapor Retarder Primer VC. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 3-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’ x 5’ area as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and overpacked the damaged leaking drum. The consignee accepted the rest of the undamaged/un-impacted freight. One 55-gallon DF containing the overpacked leaking pail was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DF containing impacted oil dry and pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DM containing impacted oil dry and pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040003
item.description:
Report E-2025040003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/31/2025, at 10:22 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parsons Yard discovered tank car NATX 301995, residue: last contained Petroleum Distillates, N.O.S., leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Berryman Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2025 0331 000056). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaving from the bottom outlet valve. Contractor personnel determined the release was the result of a faulty bottom outlet valve and a secondary closure that was less than tool tight. The car was fully empties of its contents and the secondary closure cap secured. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Sarah Lombardo (832-571-2514). The car was held at location pending further repair by a certified MRU or receipt of a OTMA from FRA.

item.title: Report E-2025040120
item.description:
Report E-2025040120

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040091
item.description:
Report E-2025040091

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0842 ET, XPO terminal XUR notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1) 5-gallon plastic jug of Spectrus NX1103 released from due to reasons unknown (arrived at the terminal empty). The release impacted 3212777 trailer floor and the skid. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (corrosive, and safety googles) Per SCM terminal is capable of the cleanup. The terminal used a 30 gallon poly drum

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and containerized them into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. One (1) 10-gallon metal drum was used to contain the damaged pail of product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
